businessProfile.name: Happy Joe's Pizza & Ice Cream - Dubuque- Century Dr.

reviews.text: 5/5. The food was delicious. We got the pan style and cheesy breadsticks. It took a little while for the pizza to get out but the manager was so kind and checked on us (we didn‚Äôt care, pizza is worth the wait). If you want fast go to somewhere gross like little caesers. *Real* pizza people know a good pizza joint when they see one. I loved the food! Wish there was one closer to us :) would absolutely recommend.

My family and I have been to a couple of Happy Joe‚Äôs in Dubuque, but it had been several years since our last visit. While we were driving through the area, we decided to stop for lunch.

Of the locations we‚Äôve been to, this is our favorite. We like the atmosphere and the general look, like a bit of a carnival feel. It‚Äôs fun, and frequently during your meal, you‚Äôll hear a honking noise, which we‚Äôve come to learn means someone is celebrating a birthday. And often, the other patrons join in signing a round of ‚ÄúHappy Birthday!‚Äù

The pizza is good with plenty of toppings. We ordered the lunch special, which includes a personal pizza and a soft drink, for $8. The great benefit is that you can order the pizza any way you want, so load up!

Service is fairly quick, and the lunch crowd didn‚Äôt seem overly packed, so we had plenty of space to sit. The parking lot is large, so you shouldn‚Äôt have a problem finding a space.

They ask for cash, but I do believe they accept credit and debit cards. If I heard right, it‚Äôs an extra $1 to pay that way.

We‚Äôve also had sandwiches there in the past, and some of those show up as a daily lunch special, which features something different Monday through Friday.

At the front of the restaurant, they also offer some ice cream and candy in case you need to fill in the space around your pizza after dinner.

If you‚Äôve never been to a Happy Joe‚Äôs, I‚Äôd suggest checking it out. And if you‚Äôre in Dubuque, see if you can stop by this location.

The pizza was absolutely delicious. The kids went up to watch them make some pizzas through a window to the kitchen and got a kick out of it! Once the cooks were done, one of them was doing jokes/mime stuff with the kids through the glass. It was so wholesome and the kids absolutely loved it! If we return to Dubuque for any reason we will likely return here for lunch as it was all around an awesome and delicious experience!

We are from out of town and when we found out that there was a Happy Joe's in Dubuque, we had to eat here. We have so many childhood memories of this place. Everything was better than we remembered. The pizza was the best pizza we have eaten. The waitress was great! She helped us with ordering and she made us up a Smores ice cream sundea which was delicious. She boxed our pizza up so it will fit in our hotel frig. We will be eating Herr again the next time we are in Dubuque.

I had to drive to Dubuque, 2 hours away from where I live. It was the closest place where I could find a part I needed for my vehicle. When looking at the map, I just saw this place nearby and I thought, I have got to try that! My name is Joe so I thought that's cool. Then when I saw the pictures on the reviews, there's something called the "Taco Joe". I happen to work at Taco Bell and one of my nicknames is Taco Joe. I thought, no way! I need to go here if for no other reason than to get pictures to show my boss.

. We got a Taco Joe pizza and a couple of drinks. The pizza was absolutely the best I probably have ever had as far as taco pizza is concerned. It was so delicious! The gentleman who took my order was super friendly and helpful, answered a few questions I had since it was my first time there. My girlfriend and I very much enjoyed the meal.

The atmosphere is absolutely amazing. High energy, just a fun, friendly feeling in the air. Apparently it's kind of a family/kids type place. Twice while we were there, birthdays were announced and the entire restaurant was asked to sing happy birthday to the birthday people. The first was a young guy, maybe late teens or early 20s, the second was a 4 year old girl. Their respective waitresses tooted loud horns to get our attention and made the announcement and request to sing, and most of us did. It was pretty fun!

The men's room was very clean. I didn't have my 2 year old granddaughter with me this day, but it was nice to see that if I had, and she needed a diaper change, there is a changing station in the men's room. That's becoming more common overall, but many independent restaurants like this one still haven't added them to men's rooms so it's always nice to see.

I will definitely be coming back here again. I don't care if I have to come alone, I need to try other menu items. I said my granddaughter is 2, but technically she will be 2 in January. Perhaps I'll try talking her parents into celebrating it here. That way I can introduce this place to several more people at the same time. If not, I'll still be back.

Since I've seen many replies to reviews from the restaurant folks, I know you read these. I want to say thank you so much for your friendliness, excellent food, clean facilities, and for just providing an overall amazing experience! Despite being somewhat busy the day we were here, our waitress was prompt with our food and our one drink refill. And she was friendly like everyone else. It's been a few days and my memory sucks, but I want to say her name is Angela maybe? Or something similar. I'm so sorry. Anyway, I appreciate her service despite my memory. üôÇüôÇüôÇ

editorial_summary.overview: Kid-friendly pizza chain known for crust choices & Mexican-inspired pies plus oversized sundaes.

recentReviews.author: Caitlin R
recentReviews.text: 5/5. The food was delicious. We got the pan style and cheesy breadsticks. It took a little while for the pizza to get out but the manager was so kind and checked on us (we didn‚Äôt care, pizza is worth the wait). If you want fast go to somewhere gross like little caesers. *Real* pizza people know a good pizza joint when they see one. I loved the food! Wish there was one closer to us :) would absolutely recommend.

recentReviews.author: Cora Seal
recentReviews.text: The pizza was absolutely delicious. The kids went up to watch them make some pizzas through a window to the kitchen and got a kick out of it! Once the cooks were done, one of them was doing jokes/mime stuff with the kids through the glass. It was so wholesome and the kids absolutely loved it! If we return to Dubuque for any reason we will likely return here for lunch as it was all around an awesome and delicious experience!

She helped us with ordering and she made us up a Smores ice cream sundea which was delicious. She boxed our pizza up so it will fit in our hotel frig. We will be eating Herr again the next time we are in Dubuque.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers are genuinely thrilled with their experience. With an average 5.0/5 rating across 5 recent reviews, your restaurant consistently exceeds expectations.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the fun and engaging atmosphere, highlighted by the carnival-like feel and birthday celebrations that involve the entire restaurant. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The pizza is highly praised for its delicious taste and generous toppings, with options to customize personal pizzas as part of the lunch special. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The staff is consistently described as friendly and attentive, enhancing the overall dining experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
